alert.note: Alert for Clarion (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 26 at 11:09PM EDT until July 27 at 1:15AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM EDT THURSDAY FOR CENTRAL CLARION COUNTY... At 1109 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms that produced heavy rain have exited the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly due to runoff from the heavy rain that has fallen. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Clarion, Knox, Strattanville, Shippenville, St. Petersburg, Fisher and Cook Forest State Park. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
